title: If Rageblade gives you 25 ap and 25 ad how will the Gathering Storm mastery know wich adaptive stats

replies.body: It will base it on your AD/AP from other items. If you have no other items with AD/AP, it will give you something based on your champion.
Is there a list on what champion gets which adaptive stat by default? If not I'd like to work on making it, but first I wanna confirm it's not wasted effort.

It probably works the same way as Camille passive shield

For instance if Camille autos Naut at level 1-2, she gets a physical damage shield.  But once Naut is level 3, it gives her a magic damage shield.   I would imagine gathering storm works in a similar way if the champ isnt building AD/AP, or has equal amounts of either.
No, Camille's passive actually look at the damage dealt over time in game. Whereas adaptive stats look at your current stats at the time T, not over time.
As far as I know, there isn't. I'd be really interested by such a list, and I might include it in the Wikia if you bother to do it. Please ping me back ;)

https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/7a3UpTHZ-wip-which-adaptive-stat-will-i-gain
I just finished doing some testing and made a list. Let me know if there's anything unclear.
Akali gets AD as her adaptive stat

I mostly agree, but I just wanted an official list out there for reference. Mostly for tanks, who generally start with an item that gives neither AD nor AP. Sion could benefit from either Q or E, depending on the situation. Most tanks probably get AP, but some might prefer to get AD for CSing.

Actually Sejuani gets AD! I did some testing and found out. It's probably to help with jungle clear.

https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/7a3UpTHZ-wip-which-adaptive-stat-will-i-gain
No. Level or skill order had no effect on which adaptive stat you gain.
Maybe you could make Rageblade as an adaptive weapon since champion who use it scale around both.

Have you considered adding a small button in the shop to switch AD and AP?

Not adaptive damage of course but adaptive damage stats

Based on your other items.

It was specifically changed to stop forcing Adaptive damage to slide over into AP every time.

> Guinsoo's Rageblade
> COST: 3000g
> [AMP Tome + Recurve Bow + Pickaxe + 690G]
> +25 AD
> +25 AP
> +25% Attack Speed
> Passive: Basic attacks deal an additional 25 magic damage on hit.
> UNIQUE Passive: Basic attacks grant +2.5% Total Attack Speed, +2.5% Attack Damage, and +2.5% Ability Power for 2.5 seconds.
> Upon reaching 6 stacks, Rageblade is fully unlocked, granting Guinsoo's Rage.
> Guinsoo's Rage: Every other basic attack will trigger on hit effects an additional time.
> While at half stacks, melee champions' next attack will fully stack Rageblade

I thing this is best version of Rageblade.
25 AD is more gold value than 25 AP (almost double) so the weighting of the system should adapt to AD.

Shouldn't it select AD? I mean AD in general is more valuable than AP in a 1:1 ratio. I feel there should be a coefficient because obviously an AD not named Jhin has around 200-250 bonus AD lategame maximum, while AP's can reach values as high as 700+ AP, 1000+ if they're named Veigar
